author: New York Times
title: The heartbreaking last texts of a hospital worker on the front lines
description: Within days of her last shift as a caregiver, Aya became a patient. She had worked in Woodhull’s understaffed emergency room, taking medical histories, ordering tests and asking about symptoms. Now she had become infected.
content:
By Michael Rothfeld, Jesse Drucker and William K. RashbaumNEW YORK: Lying in a hospital bed last month, Madhvi Aya understood what was happening to her.
She had been a doctor in India, then trained to become a physician assistant after she immigrated to the … [+9697 chars]
